snippet: A spokesman said President Obama would sign the annual military bill despite provisions that will make it extremely difficult for him to close the terrorist detention center in Cuba.
abstract: White House spokesman reveals Pres Obama is likely to sign Senate-approved annual military policy bill despite provisions that make his promise of closing detention center at Guantanamo Bay, Cuba, almost impossible; Senate also signs separate $80 billion spending bill allocated towards veterans’ programs and military construction projects.
lead_paragraph: A spokesman said President Obama would sign the annual military bill despite provisions that will make it extremely difficult for him to close the terrorist detention center in Cuba.

headline.main: Senate Passes Military Bill That Bans Transfers of Guantánamo Detainees
headline.print_headline: Bill Making It Harder to Close Guantánamo Is Approved by Senate

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
